intro: Forzzaea coutensis, commonly known as the Cape Peninsula daisies, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Forzzaea coutensis is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to the harsh coastal climate.
